article.Heading: Budget 2016: PSU banks rally 2-3% on hopes of rise in recapitalisation amount
article.Summary: ICICIDirect says it expects the government to announce additional capital infusion (compared to previously allocated Rs 70,000 crore for FY16-19 under Indradhanush plan), hike in FDI cap in public sector banks to 49 percent from 20 percent and formation of bad bank & capitalisation of the same.
article.Body:
Moneycontrol Bureau

Public sector banks' shares gained 2-3 percent Monday on hopes that the government may increase recapitalisation amount, hike FDI cap and form bad bank.

Consistent rise in non-performing assets for last five years hit balancesheets of public sector banks more compared to private banks. As a result, PSU banks reported either losses or lower profits in October-December quarter, which is likely to continue in Q4FY16 as well because of RBI new norms saying clean up balancesheets by March FY17.

Analysts say if the government does not provide capital to PSU banks, then revival of economy may get delayed due to no loans to infrastructure sector.

ICICIDirect says it expects the government to announce additional capital infusion (compared to previously allocated Rs 70,000 crore for FY16-19 under Indradhanush plan), hike in FDI cap in public sector banks to 49 percent from 20 percent and formation of bad bank & capitalisation of the same.

Anticipated capital requirement of Indian PSU banks is at Rs 1.8 lakh crore in next four years. With asset quality issues impacting profitability and lower valuation, capital raising ability of banks remain weak. Increase capital infusion will help them for balance sheet clean up and provide support for future growth, says ICICIDirect.

If the FDI cap is increased to 49 percent from 20 percnet and it results in increased foreign investment in PSU banks then it would result in much needed flow of capital, it adds.

SBI 161.25 3.43
Bank of India 85.65 2.33
Bank of Baroda 135.75 2.26
IOB 24.5 2.08
PNB 74 2.07
